title: NFL Big Data Bowl 2024
description: I used an eXtreme Gradient Boosted Classifier to model NFL tackling data. I created a Tackle Rate Over Expected metric as well as a live play animation that highlights the most likely tacklers.

title: Power Outage Analysis
description: I built a Random Forest Regression model with sklearn to analyze a dataset of power outages, using techniques like one hot encoding, hyperparameter tuning, and cross-validation to optimize model predictions.

title: Open Source Work
description: I contributed to the documentation and testing of the popular nflreadr package, used by over 100,000 people to analyze NFL data in R.

title: Wharton Moneyball Academy
description: I won the Best Final Project award at the Wharton Moneyball Academy, taught by Dr. Abraham J. Wyner. I used a k-means clustering algorithm to analyze NFL quarterbacks.

title: DSC 106 Project 1 Visualization
description: Created a table using the {gt} package in R to visualize and analyze weather trends in the United States

title: Shiny Apps.
description: Some web applications I have made using the R Shiny package.

title: Substack
description: A link to my substack with articles that use Data Science and Machine Learning to analyze sports.
